script.story_section: Okayâ€¦ I need to say this out loud because itâ€™s been eating at me. I think my girlfriend might be a monster. And I didnâ€™t realize it until the little things started stacking up.

script.story_section: Weâ€™ve been dating a few months. We bonded over the outdoors, guns, and big trucks. When I met her, I just thought: cute, confident, and she can handle a firearm like she grew up with it.
script.scene_image_description: A cartoony illustration in a dark, eerie horror atmosphere with ominous moonlit lighting of a 21-year-old woman with pale skin, long straight black hair, sharp cheekbones, bright intense eyes, wearing a fitted dark flannel shirt, rugged jeans, and worn boots, confidently holding a rifle safely pointed down, standing beside a lifted muddy pickup truck on a dirt trail with pine trees around, dark, eerie horror atmosphere with ominous moonlit lighting.

script.story_section: But once the new-relationship high calmed down, I noticed she never talked about her family. Not her parents, not a cousin, not even where she was really from.
script.scene_image_description: A cartoony illustration in a dark, eerie horror atmosphere with ominous moonlit lighting of a 23-year-old man with light skin, messy short brown hair, light stubble, wearing a dark hoodie and jeans, sitting at a small kitchen table with a confused expression, facing a 21-year-old woman with pale skin, long straight black hair, sharp cheekbones, intense eyes, wearing a dark flannel shirt and jeans, leaning back with arms crossed in a dim apartment kitchen, dark, eerie horror atmosphere with ominous moonlit lighting.

script.story_section: I asked her straight up one night. She just laughed and said, â€˜I flock from the Midwest.â€™ Like it was the funniest joke ever. Then she gave me this look likeâ€¦ donâ€™t ask again.

script.story_section: Then thereâ€™s the sleep thing. Iâ€™d wake up at like 3 a.m. and sheâ€™d just be sitting up in bed. Reading. Or just sitting in the dark. Sometimes staring at meâ€¦ not angry. More like she was guarding me.
script.scene_image_description: A cartoony illustration in a dark, eerie horror atmosphere with ominous moonlit lighting of a 21-year-old woman with pale skin, long straight black hair, sharp cheekbones, intense unblinking eyes, wearing a dark t-shirt, sitting upright on a bed holding an open book, while a 23-year-old man with light skin, messy short brown hair, light stubble, wearing a dark hoodie, lies under blankets with wide fearful eyes; the bedroom is dim with moonlight through blinds casting stripes, dark, eerie horror atmosphere with ominous moonlit lighting.

script.story_section: And sheâ€™d wake up totally fine. No bags under her eyes. No fatigue. Just full energy like she didnâ€™t spend the whole nightâ€¦ being whatever she is.

script.story_section: Oh, and pets. She hates dogs and cats. Like, instantly shuts it down. But hereâ€™s the weird partâ€¦ every dog and cat we pass loses it. Growling. Hissing. Like they know.

script.story_section: Then came the camping trip. We hike in, the forest is loudâ€”birds, bugs, everything. But the second we hit this spot where we set up campâ€¦ itâ€™s like someone hit a mute button.

script.story_section: I said, â€˜Got real quiet suddenly, didnâ€™t it?â€™ And she didnâ€™t even smile. She just goes, dead serious: â€˜Thatâ€™s just what happens when Iâ€™m around. You get used to it after awhile.â€™

script.story_section: I tried to brush it offâ€¦ until another camping trip. Different place. I wake up in the tent and sheâ€™s gone. Then I hear breathing close by. And this deep crunching soundâ€¦ like something being torn apart. And her gruntsâ€”deeper. Angry.

script.story_section: It stopped the second I moved. I zipped the tent up and pretended to sleep. A minute later she slipped back in. And thenâ€¦ I felt her breathing right by my ear. Her body pressed against me, but it didnâ€™t feel soft. It felt tight. Toned. Wrong.

script.story_section: That was weeks ago. Now she smiles at me like normal, and I swear that smile feelsâ€¦ practiced. I donâ€™t know what she is yet. But if I find out, Iâ€™ll update. If I get the chance.
